title: What classical music piece sounds like an orchestra tuning up? - Quora

response.answer_text: Leonardo Balada's "Steel Symphony" from 1972 begins in a similar fashion and has been likened to the 1945 Weigl symphony for that reason. While it does not incorporate the effect as brilliantly, the segue from the tuning up into the actual music, with no silence in between, suggests that the tuning up is intended to be part of the piece.
